text.0: come lauded unto us with powers and succours o indra with thy tawny steeds exulting.
text.1: past even the foemans manifold libations glorified with our hymns true wealthbestower.
text.2: mans friend to this our sacrifice he cometh marking how he is called by somapressers.
text.3: fearless and conscious that his steeds are noble he joyeth with the somapouring heroes.
text.4: make his cars hear that he may show his vigour and may be joyful in the way he loveth.
text.5: may mighty indra pouring forth in bounty bestow on us good roads and perfect safety.
text.6: he who with succour comes to his implorer the singer here who with his song invites him.
text.7: he who himself sets to the pole swift coursers he who hath hundreds thousands thunderwielder.
text.8: o indra maghavan by thee protected may we be thine princes and priests and singers.
text.9: sharing the riches sent from lofty heaven which yields much food and all desire its bounty.
